english.segment1: In photographs we define ourselves. Beneath the blanket of fashion. The things we fear the most. Are caught by our eyes in a mirror. We will decompose
english.segment2: Until we have faces. Identity abides. In what we claim is the truth, Till fact and faith collide
english.segment3: Until we have faces. My heart is set on you. But time and time again, My eyes believe in lies.
english.segment4: To desire and dread. A war we can't explain. One fights to remember. Another to forget himself. A face we own forever, But our heart can always change.
